official-title.#text:
Expressing the sense of the House of
		  Representatives that the Federal, State, and local police officers who have
		  fallen while fulfilling their duty both in Michigan and the United States
		  should be honored for their sacrifice and commitment to preserving law and
		  order.

sponsor.#tail: submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that the Federal, State, and local police officers who have
			 fallen while fulfilling their duty both in Michigan and the United States
			 should be honored for their sacrifice and commitment to preserving law and
			 order.

text.#text: That it is the sense of the

Whereas the week of May 12, 2013, through May 18, 2013,
			 has been designated as

Whereas in 2012 alone, at least 120 Federal, State, and
			 local police officers died in the line of duty while fulfilling their oath to
			 uphold the law; and

Whereas in Michigan, 564 known police officers have died
			 in the line of duty since 1791: Now, therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 217 IH: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that the Federal, State, and local police officers who have fallen while fulfilling their duty both in Michigan and the United States should be honored for their sacrifice and commitment to preserving law and order.
